title: The sad tale of the fonts I can't have...
content:
•I have decided to stop reading the topic about the best fonts I can’t have. It is making me uneasy. Probably something related to coveting.

•Today I made a website for the bass player I play with. (He was too good not to have one, and didn’t have the money). Probably because the recent discussion had made me remember it, the main font I used was Devroye for the buttons etc. I was a little surprised by the ampersand:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/bassguitarclear_6535.gif)
  
But it has been growing on me all day.

•So, I just read that the maker of my favorite sans font (that I can never have) has been hired by Linotype to be their font director. I can’t accuse them of bad taste.

•I don’t know why I haven’t been able to think of a good controversy to start to get my posting average up a little. I guess I covered all the bugaboos already. I could fall of the list if something doesn’t heat up.

•Kudos to the ID people here. This has to be the best place for type ID. I am very impressed. It was hinted that Stephen Coles has a secret method, and will be revealing it one day. I wonder if I understood that correctly…
author: fontplayer
